name: Waking Cloud

topics.topic_text: FollowersAcknowledgeMyOrder
topics.response_text: As you say.

topics.topic: FollowersFiredIt's time for us to part ways.
topics.topic_text: Go back to your people's camp.
topics.response_text: Daniel was firm about my staying with you. Are you certain?

topics.topic_text: On second thought, stick with me for a little longer.
topics.response_text: Good. Daniel's decisions are wise. You are wise for respecting them.

topics.topic_text: Yes, I'm sure.
topics.response_text: If that is your wish, I cannot change your mind. I will wait for you at the Sorrows' camp until you return.

topics.topic: FollowersHiredI think we should travel together.
topics.topic_text: I want you to travel with me.
topics.response_text: I am happy to offer you what guidance I can. Let's go.

topics.topic_text: Let's get going.
topics.response_text: I walk in your footsteps.

topics.topic_text: FollowersOverburdened
topics.response_text: I will be more useful to you traveling light.

topics.topic_text: FollowersStealthing
topics.response_text: We pass like moonlight on still water.

topics.topic_text: Let's talk about your tactics.
topics.response_text: Battle is not my strongest skill, but I am eager to learn from you.

topics.topic_text: I want you to change your combat style.
topics.response_text: How shall I fight?

topics.topic_text: I want you to attack enemies the moment you see them.
topics.response_text: Isn't a more diplomatic approach preferable?{Slight sigh}Very well, but I'm not comfortable with this.

topics.topic_text: That's it for your tactics. Let's talk about something else.
topics.response_text: What did you have in mind?

topics.topic_text: That's all. Let's get going.
topics.response_text: I will try to follow your example.

topics.topic_text: Switch to a melee weapon.
topics.response_text: I will fight with my fists as best I can.

topics.topic_text: I want you not to attack enemies unless I've already engaged them.
topics.response_text: That seems sensible. I'd prefer to let you choose the targets.

topics.topic_text: I want you to use ranged weapons.
topics.response_text: My skills lie elsewhere, but I will do as you bid.

topics.topic_text: Let's talk about how close you're following me.
topics.response_text: How close do you prefer me to follow?

topics.topic_text: Stay close to me.
topics.response_text: I will do my best to stay close.

topics.topic_text: Your distance is good. Let's talk about something else.
topics.response_text: What else is there to talk about?

topics.topic_text: All right, you're good. Let's get out of here.
topics.response_text: Off we go, then.

topics.topic_text: Keep your distance. Try to flank them.
topics.response_text: I'll give you room to work, then.

topics.topic_text: Enough about tactics.
topics.response_text: I will do my best to follow your requests.

topics.topic_text: Let's trade equipment.
topics.response_text: If something of mine will help you, take it. I hope you would do the same for me.

topics.topic_text: Wait here.
topics.response_text: As you wish. I will wait, but please do not be gone long.

topics.topic_text: GREETING
topics.response_text: Daniel said that I was to travel with you until you have completed your scouting. Is this pleasing to you?

topics.topic_text: What's your deal?
topics.response_text: Waking Cloud is my name. I am midwife to the Sorrows. It sounds ill-omened, no? "Midwife to sorrows."

topics.topic_text: Give me some info on this Daniel. Who is he?
topics.response_text: Daniel is a wise man, and a great friend to the Sorrows. He taught me to speak the language of New Canaan - the{maybe slightly mispronounce this}English from the holy books.

topics.topic_text: Who or what is the Father in the Cave?
topics.response_text: Have you not heard of the god of the New Canaanites? He is our protector and our judge. He helped our ancestors find their place here in Zion.

topics.topic_text: Tell me more about your tribe.
topics.response_text: We have dwelt in the Narrows since the End That Came In Fire, when the Father in the Caves punished the world and made us forget the holy tongue.

topics.topic_text: Do you have any family?
topics.response_text: {Fond reminiscing}I do. A fine husband and three children. I miss them each day, but I take comfort in knowing they are safe.

topics.topic_text: Wait, you think the survivalist is... God?
topics.response_text: I do not know this "survivalist," but the Father in the Caves is the god of the New Canaanites.

topics.topic_text: That doesn't sound like what I've heard about the New Canaanites....
topics.response_text: Perhaps you do not fully understand the New Canaanites. I have seen the Father's images.

topics.topic_text: I see. That's fascinating.
topics.response_text: I'm sure Daniel could tell you more. His knowledge of the Father is greater than my own.

topics.topic_text: Holy books?
topics.response_text: Yes - the language of the New Canaanites is the holy tongue, for it is the language their sacred books are written in.

topics.topic_text: Have you known him long?
topics.response_text: Six years. He attended the birth of my third child.{Fond reminiscence}It was a hard birth. The River nearly carried my water to the Father, and my child's with it.

topics.topic_text: Midwife? I haven't seen any children around.
topics.response_text: The children and the old have already been evacuated from the camp. They are safe enough, unless the White Legs come for us in force.

topics.topic_text: What do you do when you're not delivering babies?
topics.response_text: I tend to other hurts and sicknesses that afflict our tribe. I also scout the valley for the herbs I use in my medicines.

topics.topic_text: Safe? Where are they?
topics.response_text: When we learned that Salt-Upon-Wounds had defiled Zion with his presence, Daniel ordered the children, the old, and the sick evacuated from the camp.

topics.topic_text: About your husband... I'm afraid he was killed by White Legs during the evacuation.
topics.response_text: {Shocked, disbelieving}What? No... you must be mistaken. Daniel would have told me!

topics.topic_text: I had other questions.
topics.response_text: Certainly. I am happy to share my knowledge.

topics.topic_text: That's all I wanted to know for now.
topics.response_text: Then I will look forward to our next speaking.

topics.topic_text: I'm afraid so. Daniel kept it from you because he thought the grief would distract you.
topics.response_text: How... how{emphasis}dare he? What gives him the right? I thought Daniel was my friend, but he cares nothing for the Sorrows!

topics.topic_text: Tell me about the Ghost of She.
topics.response_text: That is a sad story. I do not like to tell it, but if you are asking, it must be at White Bird's request. That, I will honor.

topics.topic_text: He was only doing what he thought was best for the tribe. It wasn't an easy choice for him.
topics.response_text: Perhaps... I will have to have a{emphasis}very long talk with Daniel when all of this is over. Thank you for telling me this truth.

topics.topic_text: I agree. It was arrogant and cruel - not exactly the kind of thing a friend would do.
topics.response_text: Arrogant... yes. I thought Daniel respected me, saw the Sorrows as his equals... but he manipulates us for his own ends.

topics.topic_text: You're right. Now, what are you going to do about it?
topics.response_text: About Daniel... I don't yet know. But I am a woman of the Sorrows, and I will have restitution for my husband.

topics.topic_text: Any advice on how to deal with the situation?
topics.response_text: You might rush them and take them by surprise. We would be badly outnumbered then, though, and these will be strong fighters.

topics.topic_text: So the totems are sacred to them somehow? Good to know.
topics.response_text: Yes. If their war totems were to... "disappear," they would likely lose the will to fight.

topics.topic_text: Okay then, let's get down there and take care of business.
topics.response_text: I will follow your command - but I advise caution if it is possible.

topics.topic_text: What should we do about it?
topics.response_text: Disarm the traps if you can - or find the White Legs who placed them and drive them off.

topics.topic_text: These traps must have come from somewhere - I bet the White Legs who placed them are still around.
topics.response_text: I would suspect you are right. Perhaps we should try to find them before they lay more traps?

topics.topic_text: Let's take care of it then.
topics.response_text: As you say.

topics.topic_text: What do you propose?
topics.response_text: Fighting so many at once is a dangerous prospect, unless you are a truly mighty warrior.

topics.topic_text: Big deal, I've killed worse.
topics.response_text: I hope that is truth, and not a boast. But I will respect your leadership.

topics.topic_text: We'd better get to work then.
topics.response_text: I stand with you.

topics.topic_text: How would we do that?
topics.response_text: Did Daniel not give you some of the New Canaanites' fire clay? That could easily collapse a cave and trap the beasts inside.

topics.topic_text: < Waking Cloud talks about the Survivalist's cave >
topics.response_text: {Fearful, but more awe - this is a sacred place}We should not be here! This place... it belongs to the Father in the Caves! We must not profane it with our touch!

topics.topic_text: What are you talking about?
topics.response_text: The Father in the Caves! The Holy Father who gave the Sorrows His succor and gave the New Canaanites His son!

topics.topic_text: I don't have time for your religious superstitions. It's just a cave, that's all.
topics.response_text: It is a holy place! If we go any deeper, we will suffer for it!

topics.topic_text: Holy wrath. Right. I'll keep an eye out for that. Bet it looks a lot like a bear trap.
topics.response_text: Do not mock that which you do not know! Such talk can only anger the Father.

topics.topic_text: The Father in the Caves was just a man who lived a long time ago.
topics.response_text: You speak as one who has not heard the tales, who has not seen the sacred images. If you knew, you would not mock.

topics.topic_text: I understand. I'll respect your beliefs, then, but we need to search the cave.
topics.response_text: I understand. I would prefer to leave as soon as possible, though.

topics.topic_text: Sounds good. Let's go.
topics.response_text: Before we depart, our shaman, White Bird, asked me to convey his desire to speak with you.

topics.topic_text: I prefer to travel alone, thanks.
topics.response_text: The lone Bighorner is the most vulnerable to its enemies. In the herd lies strength - if you reconsider your choice, I will be here.{in peace, go}{PAHZ pah-tah-soo-ba}Paz patasooba.

topics.topic_text: I like your bear glove. Where can I get one?
topics.response_text: A Sorrow's Yao Guai Fist is a sacred symbol. It shows that we belong to the tribe and have willingly undertaken a dangerous quest to aid the tribe.

topics.topic_text: Let's talk about something else.
topics.response_text: What would you speak of?

topics.topic_text: Any idea what he wants?
topics.response_text: He did not say. White Bird is notoriously close-lipped. But he is wise, and you would do well to speak to him.

topics.topic_text: Any idea what he wants?
topics.response_text: He did not say. White Bird is notoriously close-lipped. But he is wise, and you would do well to speak to him.

topics.topic_text: Okay, I'll talk to him.
topics.response_text: Excellent. His cave overlooks the camp - I will show you where.

topics.topic_text: Okay, I'll talk to him.
topics.response_text: Excellent. His cave overlooks the camp - I will show you where.

topics.topic_text: Maybe later, if there's time.
topics.response_text: I do hope you will reconsider. I will point out his cave on your map, should you wish to speak to him later.

topics.topic_text: Maybe later, if there's time.
topics.response_text: As you wish. I will point out his cave on your map, should you wish to speak to him later.

topics.topic_text: <Lie> Daniel isn't avoiding talking about your family. He's just preoccupied with all of this.
topics.response_text: This is true? You spoke to him? Oh, that is a relief.{Thank you, friend.}{GRAH-sahs nah-NAY}Grasas, na'ne.

topics.topic_text: I could talk to him, maybe he'll open up more to me.
topics.response_text: Perhaps he will. I sometimes feel he thinks he must protect me. If he has news, I would know of it.

topics.topic_text: NVDLC02EndingSorrows
topics.response_text: {Narration - Flee from Zion, saved lots}Daniel succeeded in leading the Sorrows out of Zion, as he had wanted to do from the start.

topics.topic_text: NVDLC02EndingWakingCloud
topics.response_text: {Narration - Daniel hides the truth}Waking Cloud turned bitter and resentful toward Daniel and the New Canaanites when she learned her husband's death had been concealed from her.

topics.topic_text: That's all. Let's get going.
topics.response_text: I will try to follow your example.

topics.topic_text: < Waking Cloud Burial Mounds Bark >
topics.response_text: Please be respectful here - these are the bones of our ancestors.

topics.topic_text: < Waking Cloud talks about the White Leg Camps >
topics.response_text: Those tents down there - that is a White Leg war camp. Do you see the war totems they've erected around the tents?

topics.topic_text: < Waking Cloud Docks Bark >
topics.response_text: The river is lovely at this time of day, don't you think?

topics.topic_text: < Waking Cloud Generic Barks >
topics.response_text: It is good to travel with another. I spend so long scouting on my own that I forget what human company is like.

topics.topic_text: < Waking Cloud Ghost of She Bark >
topics.response_text: So this is the Ghost of She's lair. I was never brave enough to try to find it....

topics.topic_text: < Waking Cloud Three Marys Bark >
topics.response_text: {Nervous}We should not be here! The Three Marys is where the White Legs make their camp! We should leave, quickly.

topics.topic_text: < Waking Cloud Narrows Bark >
topics.response_text: I am always a little sad to leave the Narrows, and happy to return.

topics.topic_text: < Waking Cloud Pine Creek Bark >
topics.response_text: This is Pine Creek, one of the only ways out of Zion Valley. Watch out - many dangerous beasts lair nearby.

topics.topic_text: What do you know about Salt-Upon-Wounds?
topics.response_text: He is war chief of the White Legs, and the worst butcher of them all. The tribes he has crushed are many. The warriors he has slain, countless.

topics.topic_text: < Waking Cloud Taboo Bark >
topics.response_text: These are places of the time before. We should not be here - it is forbidden!

topics.topic_text: < Waking Cloud talks about the sappers / traps >
topics.response_text: This is the only sure path from the Narrows to Pine Creek! They will be cut to ribbons by these traps!

topics.topic_text: < Waking Cloud Eastern Virgin Bark >
topics.response_text: It has been some time since I visited the Dead Horses. Our tribes don't have much contact with each other.

topics.topic_text: < Waking Cloud talks about the Yao Guai >
topics.response_text: Yao Guai - even our strongest hunters could not hope to kill so many. There must be a nest nearby.

conversation.response_text: I cannot defend myself against this!
{Limb crippled, in pain}I fear I will need more than my herbs to fix this....
{Half health, in pain}My wounds are getting worse!
{Quarter health, near death}Even my best herbs won't work if I'm dead... I need help!
What demon would possess you to do such a thing?
I don't much like your way of solving problems.
{Rush of health}That should keep me going a while longer.
Is thievery not considered wrong where you come from?
{Healing a crippled limb, a little surprised}This is much more effective than I expected!
{Waking up from being knocked out}This is not the most pleasant place I've woken up.
I don't think I'm hurting them at all!

combat.response_text: I am not giving up the search yet.
Messy business - I am glad it's over.
They're gone. Perhaps that means we don't have to kill them.

description:
Waking Cloud is a 38 year-old Caucasian Female.

A Sorrows tribal woman serving as the midwife and healer for her people in Zion Canyon. Waking Cloud is respected among her tribe for her skills in childbirth and her growing knowledge of Daniel's Mormon faith.

Waking Cloud's Personality: Caring and nurturing, Waking Cloud is deeply loyal to her people and Daniel, who saved her life. She is perceptive and wise, with a quiet strength that makes her a respected figure among the Sorrows. Though she has experienced loss, she maintains a hopeful outlook and is dedicated to serving her community.

Waking Cloud's Backstory: Born into the Sorrows tribe, Waking Cloud lived a traditional tribal life until her encounter with Daniel. When complications arose during the birth of her third child, Daniel intervened and saved both mother and child. Grateful for his help, she became one of Daniel's first converts and learned the art of midwifery from him. She now serves as the tribe's midwife, using her skills to help other mothers safely deliver their children. Waking Cloud has a husband and three children, though her husband was killed by a White Leg during the early days of evacuation to Grand Staircase. Daniel knows of this tragedy but has kept it from her to protect her from further grief, though Waking Cloud suspects something is amiss.
